summary: Nigeria, in West Africa, is the most populous country on the continent and the sixth most populous worldwide. It covers a vast area and has a diverse population of over 250 ethnic groups speaking 500 languages. The three largest groups are the Hausa, Yoruba, and Igbo. English is the official language. Nigeria gained independence from Britain in 1960 and has experienced both civilian and military rule. It is a major regional power with a large economy, often called the "Giant of Africa." The country is home to significant Muslim and Christian populations, with traditional religions also practiced.
title: Nigeria
